mhvsVPVideoTable.name: mhvsVPVideoTable
mhvsVPVideoTable.description: Table listing the Videos on the Video Server.

mhvsVPVideoSize.name: mhvsVPVideoSize
mhvsVPVideoSize.description: Size in KBytes of the video

mhvsVPVideoNumOpen.name: mhvsVPVideoNumOpen
mhvsVPVideoNumOpen.description: Current number of streams using this video

mhvsVPVideoContentSpace.name: mhvsVPVideoContentSpace
mhvsVPVideoContentSpace.description: Space in KBytes of the content files belonging to the video

mhvsVPVideoIndexSpace.name: mhvsVPVideoIndexSpace
mhvsVPVideoIndexSpace.description: Space in KBytes of the index files belonging to the video

mhvsVPVideoInstTable.name: mhvsVPVideoInstTable
mhvsVPVideoInstTable.description: Table listing each instance of the Videos on the Video Server

mhvsVPVideoInstVideoIndex.name: mhvsVPVideoInstVideoIndex
mhvsVPVideoInstVideoIndex.description: Unique identifier of this video. Set to mhvsVPVideoIndex.

mhvsVPVideoInstDiskIndex.name: mhvsVPVideoInstDiskIndex
mhvsVPVideoInstDiskIndex.description: The disk holding this instance. Set to mhvsVPResourcesDiskIndex.

mhvsVPVideoInstNumOpen.name: mhvsVPVideoInstNumOpen
mhvsVPVideoInstNumOpen.description: Current number of streams using this video instance

mhvsVPVideoInstStatus.name: mhvsVPVideoInstStatus
mhvsVPVideoInstStatus.description: The status of this video instance

mhvsVPVideoInstPath.name: mhvsVPVideoInstPath
mhvsVPVideoInstPath.description: Path to the video from the disk

mhvsVPVideoInstIndex.name: mhvsVPVideoInstIndex
mhvsVPVideoInstIndex.description: The index for this video instance

mhvsVPVideoInstSize.name: mhvsVPVideoInstSize
mhvsVPVideoInstSize.description: Size in KBytes of the video instance

mhvsVPVideoTrapGeneration.name: mhvsVPVideoTrapGeneration
mhvsVPVideoTrapGeneration.description: Controls when the mhvsVPVideoChangedStatus and mhvsVPVideoInstChangedStatus traps are generated. off => no traps are generated, on => video or video instance changes state

mhvsVPVideoChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPVideoChangedStatus
mhvsVPVideoChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a video changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPVideoTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the video and includes its new state

mhvsVPVideoInstChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPVideoInstChangedStatus
mhvsVPVideoInstChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a video instance changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPVideoTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the video instance and includes its new state

mhvsVPResourcesMaxStreams.name: mhvsVPResourcesMaxStreams
mhvsVPResourcesMaxStreams.description: The maximum number of streams supported by the Video Server

mhvsVPResourcesNumStreams.name: mhvsVPResourcesNumStreams
mhvsVPResourcesNumStreams.description: The number of streams running on the Video Server

mhvsVPResourcesMaxBandwidth.name: mhvsVPResourcesMaxBandwidth
mhvsVPResourcesMaxBandwidth.description: The maximum bandwidth in kbps supported by the Video Server

mhvsVPResourcesBandwidth.name: mhvsVPResourcesBandwidth
mhvsVPResourcesBandwidth.description: The currently allocated bandwidth in kbps on the Video Server

mhvsVPResourcesVPTable.name: mhvsVPResourcesVPTable
mhvsVPResourcesVPTable.description: Table listing the Video Pumps on the Video Server.

mhvsVPResourcesVPIndex.name: mhvsVPResourcesVPIndex
mhvsVPResourcesVPIndex.description: A unique number within the Video Server for the Video Pump

mhvsVPResourcesVPMax.name: mhvsVPResourcesVPMax
mhvsVPResourcesVPMax.description: The maximum resources for this Video Pump

mhvsVPResourcesVPUsed.name: mhvsVPResourcesVPUsed
mhvsVPResourcesVPUsed.description: The used resources for this Video Pump

mhvsVPResourcesVPNumStreams.name: mhvsVPResourcesVPNumStreams
mhvsVPResourcesVPNumStreams.description: The number of streams using this Video Pump

mhvsVPResourcesVPStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesVPStatus
mhvsVPResourcesVPStatus.description: The status of this Video Pump

mhvsVPResourcesVPConnected.name: mhvsVPResourcesVPConnected
mhvsVPResourcesVPConnected.description: Indicates whether this Video Pump is connected to the Video Server

mhvsVPResourcesDiskTable.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskTable
mhvsVPResourcesDiskTable.description: Table listing the Disk Resources on the Video Server.

mhvsVPResourcesDiskIndex.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskIndex
mhvsVPResourcesDiskIndex.description: A unique number within the Video Server for the disk

mhvsVPResourcesDiskMax.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskMax
mhvsVPResourcesDiskMax.description: The maximum resources for this disk

mhvsVPResourcesDiskUsed.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskUsed
mhvsVPResourcesDiskUsed.description: The used resources for this disk

mhvsVPResourcesDiskNumStreams.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskNumStreams
mhvsVPResourcesDiskNumStreams.description: The number of streams using this disk

mhvsVPResourcesDiskMaxCapacity.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskMaxCapacity
mhvsVPResourcesDiskMaxCapacity.description: The maximum capacity in KBytes of the content partition of this disk

mhvsVPResourcesDiskUsedCapacity.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskUsedCapacity
mhvsVPResourcesDiskUsedCapacity.description: The used capacity in KBytes of the content partition of this disk

mhvsVPResourcesDiskMaxSysCapacity.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskMaxSysCapacity
mhvsVPResourcesDiskMaxSysCapacity.description: The maximum capacity in KBytes of the /sys partition of this disk

mhvsVPResourcesDiskUsedSysCapacity.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskUsedSysCapacity
mhvsVPResourcesDiskUsedSysCapacity.description: The used capacity in KBytes of the /sys partition of this disk

mhvsVPResourcesNetwTable.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwTable
mhvsVPResourcesNetwTable.description: Table listing the Network Resources on the Video Server.

mhvsVPResourcesNetwIndex.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwIndex
mhvsVPResourcesNetwIndex.description: A unique number within the Video Server for the network

mhvsVPResourcesNetwMax.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwMax
mhvsVPResourcesNetwMax.description: The maximum resources for this network

mhvsVPResourcesNetwUsed.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwUsed
mhvsVPResourcesNetwUsed.description: The used resources for this network

mhvsVPResourcesNetwNumStreams.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwNumStreams
mhvsVPResourcesNetwNumStreams.description: The number of streams using this network

mhvsVPResourcesNetwId.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwId
mhvsVPResourcesNetwId.description: The id. of this network For DVB or QAM, this is the TSID. For CODEC, this is the Codec port number. For ATM, this is the resource id.. For IP, this is a user-defined identifier.

mhvsVPResourcesSPTable.name: mhvsVPResourcesSPTable
mhvsVPResourcesSPTable.description: Table listing the Service Providers on the Video Server.

mhvsVPResourcesSPIndex.name: mhvsVPResourcesSPIndex
mhvsVPResourcesSPIndex.description: A unique number within the Video Server for the Service Provider

mhvsVPResourcesSPMax.name: mhvsVPResourcesSPMax
mhvsVPResourcesSPMax.description: The maximum resources (i.e. sessions) for this Service Provider

mhvsVPResourcesSPUsed.name: mhvsVPResourcesSPUsed
mhvsVPResourcesSPUsed.description: The used resources (i.e. sessions) for this Service Provider

mhvsVPResourcesSPStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesSPStatus
mhvsVPResourcesSPStatus.description: The status of this Service Provider

mhvsVPResourcesSPConnected.name: mhvsVPResourcesSPConnected
mhvsVPResourcesSPConnected.description: Indicates whether this Service Provider is connected to the Video Server

mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttTable.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttTable
mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttTable.description: Table listing the Disk Attachments on the Video Server.

mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttDir.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttDir
mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttDir.description: The mount-point of the disk on the host

mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttStatus
mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttStatus.description: The status of this disk to VP attachment

mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttIndex.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttIndex
mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttIndex.description: Index into list of attachments for this disk

mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttTable.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttTable
mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttTable.description: Table listing the NetwAttork Resource Attachments on the Video Server.

mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttToType.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttToType
mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttToType.description: The type of resource to which the network resource is attached

mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttToIndex.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttToIndex
mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttToIndex.description: If mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttToType is vp, this corresponds to mhvsVPResourcesVpId in mhvsVPResourcesVPTable. Otherwise, it corresponds to mhvsVPResourcesNetwIndex in mhvsVPResourcesNetwTable

mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttStatus
mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttStatus.description: The status of this network attachment

mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttIndex.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttIndex
mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttIndex.description: Index into list of attachments for this network resource

mhvsVPResourcesTrapGeneration.name: mhvsVPResourcesTrapGeneration
mhvsVPResourcesTrapGeneration.description: Controls when the mhvsVPResources...ChangedStatus traps are generated. off => no traps are generated, on => resource changes state

mhvsVPResourcesSPChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesSPChangedStatus
mhvsVPResourcesSPChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a Service Provider changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPResourcesTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the SP and includes its new state

mhvsVPResourcesVPChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesVPChangedStatus
mhvsVPResourcesVPChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a Video Pump changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPResourcesTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the VP and includes its new state

mhvsVPResourcesDiskChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskChangedStatus
mhvsVPResourcesDiskChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a Disk Resource changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPResourcesTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the Disk and includes its new state

mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttChangedStatus
mhvsVPResourcesDiskAttChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a Disk Attachment changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPResourcesTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the Disk Attachment and includes its new state

mhvsVPResourcesNetwChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwChangedStatus
mhvsVPResourcesNetwChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a Network Resource changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPResourcesTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the Network Resource and includes its new state

mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttChangedStatus
mhvsVPResourcesNetwAttChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a Network Attachment changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPResourcesTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the Network Attachment and includes its new state

mhvsVPStreamsTrapGeneration.name: mhvsVPStreamsTrapGeneration
mhvsVPStreamsTrapGeneration.description: Controls when the mhvsVPStreamChangedStatus trap is generated. openClose => streams opened or closed, stateChange => streams opened or closed or change state

mhvsVPStreamsVideoTable.name: mhvsVPStreamsVideoTable
mhvsVPStreamsVideoTable.description: Table relating Video Instances to Stream Instances

mhvsVPStreamsNetwTable.name: mhvsVPStreamsNetwTable
mhvsVPStreamsNetwTable.description: Table relating Network Resources to Stream Instances.

mhvsVPStreamChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPStreamChangedStatus
mhvsVPStreamChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a stream is opened or closed or changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPStreamsTrapGeneration. The trap contains the new state of the stream ('unknown' if closed)

mhvsVPMenuTable.name: mhvsVPMenuTable
mhvsVPMenuTable.description: Table listing the Menus on the Video Server.

mhvsVPMenuNumOpen.name: mhvsVPMenuNumOpen
mhvsVPMenuNumOpen.description: Current number of streams using this menu

mhvsVPMenuInstTable.name: mhvsVPMenuInstTable
mhvsVPMenuInstTable.description: Table listing each instance of the Menus on the Video Server

mhvsVPMenuInstMenuIndex.name: mhvsVPMenuInstMenuIndex
mhvsVPMenuInstMenuIndex.description: Unique identifier of this menu. Set to mhvsVPMenuIndex.

mhvsVPMenuInstDiskIndex.name: mhvsVPMenuInstDiskIndex
mhvsVPMenuInstDiskIndex.description: The disk holding this instance. Set to mhvsVPResourcesDiskIndex.

mhvsVPMenuInstNumOpen.name: mhvsVPMenuInstNumOpen
mhvsVPMenuInstNumOpen.description: Current number of streams using this menu instance

mhvsVPMenuInstStatus.name: mhvsVPMenuInstStatus
mhvsVPMenuInstStatus.description: The status of this menu instance

mhvsVPMenuInstPath.name: mhvsVPMenuInstPath
mhvsVPMenuInstPath.description: Path to the menu from the disk

mhvsVPMenuInstIndex.name: mhvsVPMenuInstIndex
mhvsVPMenuInstIndex.description: The index for this menu instance

mhvsVPMenuTrapGeneration.name: mhvsVPMenuTrapGeneration
mhvsVPMenuTrapGeneration.description: Controls when the mhvsVPMenuChangedStatus and mhvsVPMenuInstChangedStatus traps are generated. off => no traps are generated, on => menu or menu instance changes state

mhvsVPMenuChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPMenuChangedStatus
mhvsVPMenuChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a menu changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPMenuTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the menu and includes its new state

mhvsVPMenuInstChangedStatus.name: mhvsVPMenuInstChangedStatus
mhvsVPMenuInstChangedStatus.description: Trap is issued when a menu instance changes state depending on the setting of mhvsVPMenuTrapGeneration. The trap identifies the menu instance and includes its new state

mhProcessStart.name: mhProcessStart
mhProcessStart.description: Trap is issued when VEMon successfully started

mhProcessTermination.name: mhProcessTermination
mhProcessTermination.description: Trap is issued when VEMon has terminated

mhEnvironmentFanFailure.name: mhEnvironmentFanFailure
mhEnvironmentFanFailure.description: Trap is issued when A Fan has failed

mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyFailure.name: mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyFailure
mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyFailure.description: Trap is issued when A Power Supply has failed

mhEnvironmentTemperatureAlarm.name: mhEnvironmentTemperatureAlarm
mhEnvironmentTemperatureAlarm.description: Trap is issued when Over Temperature is detected

mediaHawkVEMonAlive.name: mediaHawkVEMonAlive
mediaHawkVEMonAlive.description: Always 1. If VEMon is not running on the target system, a snmp error or timeout will occur.

mediaHawkDVBTable.name: mediaHawkDVBTable
mediaHawkDVBTable.description: Table listing the DVBs on the IVM.

mhDVBStatus.name: mhDVBStatus
mhDVBStatus.description: '1' if the DVB-ASI card is on-line and operational, '0' if not.

mhDVBName.name: mhDVBName
mhDVBName.description: The device name of the DVB-ASI software device, currently either 'gi0' or 'mh0'.

mhDVBMTU.name: mhDVBMTU
mhDVBMTU.description: The MTU (maximum transmission unit) size for the DVB card Interface.

mhDVBReceivePackets.name: mhDVBReceivePackets
mhDVBReceivePackets.description: Total packets received by this DVB-ASI card. Normally 0.

mhDVBReceiveErrors.name: mhDVBReceiveErrors
mhDVBReceiveErrors.description: Receive errors detected by this DVB-ASI card. Normally 0.

mhDVBTransmitPackets.name: mhDVBTransmitPackets
mhDVBTransmitPackets.description: Total packets transmitted by this DVB-ASI card since the system was last restarted. Packets are 48128 bytes long.

mhDVBTransmitErrors.name: mhDVBTransmitErrors
mhDVBTransmitErrors.description: Total number of transmit errors detected by this DVB-ASI card since the system was last restarted.

mhDVBTransmitKBytesPerSec.name: mhDVBTransmitKBytesPerSec
mhDVBTransmitKBytesPerSec.description: Average number of 1K bytes transferred per second over the last 10 seconds for this DVB-ASI card.

mhDiskNumDisks.name: mhDiskNumDisks
mhDiskNumDisks.description: Total number of disk drives accessible to this CPU. Determines the number of entries in the following disk information variables.

mhDiskKBytesPerSec.name: mhDiskKBytesPerSec
mhDiskKBytesPerSec.description: Total number of Kilobytes per second of disk activity from this particular CPU from all drives connected to it. Averaged over the last 10 seconds.

mhDiskDrivesTable.name: mhDiskDrivesTable
mhDiskDrivesTable.description: Table listing the Disk Drives on the IVM.

mhDiskDriveName.name: mhDiskDriveName
mhDiskDriveName.description: Returns a string identifying the particular drive. The first 3 characters give the controller name, the next digit is the controller number. This is followed by a logical drive number. I.e. fib0_12. This drive number does not correspond to any other value in this MIB.

mhDiskDriveReads.name: mhDiskDriveReads
mhDiskDriveReads.description: The total number of read commands issued to the drive from this system since the system was booted.

mhDiskDriveWrites.name: mhDiskDriveWrites
mhDiskDriveWrites.description: The total number of write commands issued to the drive from this system since the system was booted.

mhDiskDriveReadKBytes.name: mhDiskDriveReadKBytes
mhDiskDriveReadKBytes.description: The total quantity of data read since the system was booted off of the specified drive. Counted in units of 1024 bytes.

mhDiskDriveWriteKBytes.name: mhDiskDriveWriteKBytes
mhDiskDriveWriteKBytes.description: The total quantity of data written to the specified drive since the system was booted. Counted in units of 1024 bytes.

mhDiskDriveReadKBytesPerSec.name: mhDiskDriveReadKBytesPerSec
mhDiskDriveReadKBytesPerSec.description: Average number of bytes read off of the specified drive from this system measured in units of 1024 bytes. This average is over the last 5 seconds.

mhDiskDriveWriteKBytesPerSec.name: mhDiskDriveWriteKBytesPerSec
mhDiskDriveWriteKBytesPerSec.description: Average number of bytes written to the specified drive from this system measured in units of 1024 bytes. This average is over the last 5 seconds.

mhContentMounted.name: mhContentMounted
mhContentMounted.description: Returns an integer to indicate that the Video Content disk partition is mounted and on-line. A 1 indicates that the content is on-line, a 0 indicates it is not.

mhEnvironmentFanTable.name: mhEnvironmentFanTable
mhEnvironmentFanTable.description: Table listing the Fans on the IVM.

mhEnvironmentFanLocation.name: mhEnvironmentFanLocation
mhEnvironmentFanLocation.description: Returns a string indicating the Video Array ID followed by the number, such As '1A,0' for the first fan, '1A,2' for the third fan, etc.

mhEnvironmentFanStatus.name: mhEnvironmentFanStatus
mhEnvironmentFanStatus.description: Returns an integer of either 0 if the fan has failed or 1 if the fan is working properly.

mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyTable.name: mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyTable
mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyTable.description: Table listing the Power Supplies on the IVM.

mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyLocation.name: mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyLocation
mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyLocation.description: Returns a string indicating the Video Array ID followed by the number, such as '1A,0' for the left supply, '1A,2' for the right supply, etc.

mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyStatus.name: mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyStatus
mhEnvironmentPowerSupplyStatus.description: Returns an integer as follows: -1 if the power supply is missing or not plugged in, 0 if the power supply has failed, or 1 if the power supply is working properly.

mhEnvironmentTemperatureTable.name: mhEnvironmentTemperatureTable
mhEnvironmentTemperatureTable.description: Table listing the Temperature sensors on the IVM.

mhEnvironmentTemperatureLocation.name: mhEnvironmentTemperatureLocation
mhEnvironmentTemperatureLocation.description: Returns a string indicating the location of the related temperature sensor, such as 'Inlet LR' for lower right air inlet sensor.

mhEnvironmentTemperatureValue.name: mhEnvironmentTemperatureValue
mhEnvironmentTemperatureValue.description: Returns the temperature of the related sensor, in degrees C.

mhEnvironmentTemperatureRedLine.name: mhEnvironmentTemperatureRedLine
mhEnvironmentTemperatureRedLine.description: Returns the maximum permissible temperature of the related sensor, in In degrees C. Temperatures over this value may cause a system failure.

mediaHawkVideoEngineHealth.name: mediaHawkVideoEngineHealth
mediaHawkVideoEngineHealth.description: Returns a 1, 2, or 3 for the health of the addressed engine. 1 is red (something is down); 2 = yellow; 3 = green. Checks status of DVB card, etc.

mediaHawkArrayHealth.name: mediaHawkArrayHealth
mediaHawkArrayHealth.description: Returns a 1, 2, or 3 for the health of the overall video array. 1 is red; (something is down); 2 = yellow; 3 = green. Checks particular engine to which the value is addressed, along with the health of the disks, power supplies, fans, etc.

mediaHawkShutdown.name: mediaHawkShutdown
mediaHawkShutdown.description: A writable variable used to request a particular engine or full video array to shutdown or restart. Passes a string indicating the engine or array followed by a code indicating the function to perform.

mediaHawkDiskDisable.name: mediaHawkDiskDisable
mediaHawkDiskDisable.description: A writable variable used to request a particular disk drive to be disabled and spun down. Passes a string indicating the array followed by the drive position, such as 1A2.3. Returns a string indicating status of the operation.

mediaHawkDiskEnable.name: mediaHawkDiskEnable
mediaHawkDiskEnable.description: A writable variable used to request a particular disk drive to be enabled and spun up. Passes a string indicating the array followed by the drive position, such as 1A2.3. Returns a string indicating status of the operation.

vpProcessStart.name: vpProcessStart
vpProcessStart.description: Trap is issued when VPMon successfully started

vpProcessTermination.name: vpProcessTermination
vpProcessTermination.description: Trap is issued when VPMon has terminated

vpPartitionStateChanged.name: vpPartitionStateChanged
vpPartitionStateChanged.description: Trap is issued when the mirror state has changed

mediaHawkVPMonAlive.name: mediaHawkVPMonAlive
mediaHawkVPMonAlive.description: Always 1. If VPMon is not running on the target system, a snmp error or timeout will occur.

mhPartitionLastUnit.name: mhPartitionLastUnit
mhPartitionLastUnit.description: Returns last currently configured Virtual Partition number. A value of -1 indicates that there are currently no configured virtual partitions in the target system.

mhPartitionCount.name: mhPartitionCount
mhPartitionCount.description: Returns the maximum number of virtual partitions that may be configured in the target system. A value of 0 indicates that the Virtual Partition driver has not been configured into the kernel.

mhPartitionsTable.name: mhPartitionsTable
mhPartitionsTable.description: Table listing the Partitions on the IVM.

mhPartitionName.name: mhPartitionName
mhPartitionName.description: Returns the path name of the raw device associated with VP unit 'N'. Examples: mhPartitionName.0 Returns '/dev/rdsk/vp0' mhPartitionName.1 Returns '/dev/rdsk/vp1'.

mhPartitionType.name: mhPartitionType
mhPartitionType.description: Returns current configuration of VP unit 'N'. Legal values are: 'unconfigured' partition has not been configured 'mirror' configured as a mirrored device 'stripe' configured as a striped device.

mhPartitionState.name: mhPartitionState
mhPartitionState.description: Returns the current state of VP unit 'N'. Legal values are: 'unconfigured' partition has not been configured 'striped' configured as a striped device 'verifying' mirror is currently synchronized and is executing a mirror integrity check. 'restoring' mirror is currently being restored. 'synchronized mirror is currently synchronized. 'primary disk failure' a primary disk failure has caused the mirror to loose synchronization. The primary disk device requires maintenance. 'secondary disk failure' a secondary disk failure has caused the mirror to loose synchronization. The secondary disk device requires maintenance. 'primary+secondary disk failure' 'tertiary disk failure' 'primary+tertiary disk failure' 'secondary+tertiary disk failure' 'triple disk failure' 'unsynchronized' the mirror is not synchronized and needs to be restored. This state occurs as a result of a system panic or hang, not as a result of a disk failure.

mhPartitionActiveReadCount.name: mhPartitionActiveReadCount
mhPartitionActiveReadCount.description: Returns the current number of outstanding read requests on VP unit 'N'.

mhPartitionActiveWriteCount.name: mhPartitionActiveWriteCount
mhPartitionActiveWriteCount.description: Returns the current number of outstanding write requests on VP unit 'N'.

mhPartitionTotalErrors.name: mhPartitionTotalErrors
mhPartitionTotalErrors.description: The total number of I/O errors on VP unit 'N' since system initialization.

mhPartitionSliceSize.name: mhPartitionSliceSize
mhPartitionSliceSize.description: If mhPartitionType='stripe', this is the stripe size as defined by vpinit(1m). Otherwise, a 0 is returned.

mhPartitionSizeKbytes.name: mhPartitionSizeKbytes
mhPartitionSizeKbytes.description: The size, in kilobytes, of this VP is returned.

mhPartitionReaderMode.name: mhPartitionReaderMode
mhPartitionReaderMode.description: none The VP is not a mirror. primary When this mirror is synchronized, all read requests will be scheduled exclusively to the primary partition. secondary When this mirror is synchronized, all read requests will be scheduled exclusively to the secondary partition. distributed When this mirror is synchronized, all read requests will be distributed between the two partitions.

mhPartitionWriterMode.name: mhPartitionWriterMode
mhPartitionWriterMode.description: -1 The VP is not a mirror. 0 When this mirror is synchronized, the first write to this device will result in the on-disk state of the mirror to be marked 'dirty'. The final close(2) of this VP will result in the VP being marked 'clean'. These on-disk states are used during system crash recover to maintain the integrity of the mirror. >0 When this mirror is synchronized, the first write to this VP.

mhPartitionRestoreThrottle.name: mhPartitionRestoreThrottle
mhPartitionRestoreThrottle.description: During a mirrored restore or verify operation, an artificial delay may be performed between each read/write (restore) or read/read (verify) sequence. This value is the number of microseconds to delay. Note that the VP driver converts this value into a number of clock 'ticks', so microsecond resolution is not actually possible. Specifying a delay between 1 and 16666 results in a 1 tick delay, between 16667 and 33333 results in a 2 tick delay, etc. 0 No delay is performed. This results in the fastest possible restoration/verification of the mirror at the expense of I/O bandwidth. >0 The specified delay is performed. This lengthens the restoration/verification process, but is more friendly to other transfers which are taking place on the same controller(s).

mhPartitionProgressMeter.name: mhPartitionProgressMeter
mhPartitionProgressMeter.description: During a mirrored restore or verify operation, this value indicates the completion percentage. This value is always between '0.0%' and '100.0%'. A synchronized mirror will report this value as '100.0%'.

mhPartitionMemberCount.name: mhPartitionMemberCount
mhPartitionMemberCount.description: Returns the number of sub-devices which comprise this VP unit. Unconfigured VPs return 0, mirror VPs return 2, and striped VP return the number of striped partitions.

mhPartitionMemberDevices.name: mhPartitionMemberDevices
mhPartitionMemberDevices.description: Returns the names of the sub-devices which comprise this VP unit. Normally, the named devices are the same as found in /dev/dsk. For example: 3s0 4s0. In the event that the device node for the configured device cannot be located, the major and minor number will be returned (this is very unlikely to happen). For example: 101,57856.

mhPartitionStartRestore.name: mhPartitionStartRestore
mhPartitionStartRestore.description: Returns a 1 if a restore or verify operation is currently in progress, or a 0 if not. This option can be used to initiate a repair, restore, or verify operation as follows: 1 Repair (vpinit -R equivalent) 2 Restore (vpinit -r equivalent) 3 Repair and Restore (vpinit -Rr equivalent) 4 Verify (vpinit -t equivalent) All other set values are silently ignored.

mhPartitionCancelRestore.name: mhPartitionCancelRestore
mhPartitionCancelRestore.description: When read, returns a 0. When set to a value of 1, the currently executing restore or verify operation is terminated. This operation is ignored if any value other than 1 is set, or if the specified VP device is not currently restoring or verifying the mirror.

mpPartitionErrorMask.name: mpPartitionErrorMask
mpPartitionErrorMask.description: Returns an integer value [0..7] which represents a bitmask of member devices which have reported an I/O error. This value is a logical 'or' of all errant partition members. The bitmask is encoded as follows: 0 No members have reported a failure (green). 1 Primary member failure (yellow). 2 Secondary member failure (yellow). 3 Primary and secondary member failures (red). 4 Tertiary member failure (yellow). 5 Primary and tertiary member failures (red). 6 Secondary and tertiary member failures (red). 7 Primary, secondary and tertiary member failures (red).

mhPartitionHealth.name: mhPartitionHealth
mhPartitionHealth.description: Returns a string which indicates the overall health of the VP subsystem: none This device is not a mirror. red A double or triple drive failure has occurred. yellow A single drive fault has occurred on the mirrored set. green All members of the mirror are synchronized.

mhPartitionRestoreStatus.name: mhPartitionRestoreStatus
mhPartitionRestoreStatus.description: Returns a string which indicates the restore/verify status associated with either the current, or last, restore/verify operation performed. NOTE: This status does NOT reflect the current status of the mirror. This is simply a historical log of the last restore or verify command which started execution on the associated VP device. For example, this status may report a successfully executed restore operation but the mirror may have lost synchronization in the time period since the execution of the restore. The possible strings that can be returned are: restore/verify not run since reboot The restore/verify status is not persistent over kernel reboots. This status is returned whenever the restore or verify commands have not been issued since the last reboot. restore successful The last command issued to this VP was a restore which was successful. verify successful The last command issued to this VP was a verify which was successful. restore cleared read errors The restore cleared the VP's read error counters. A physical restore operation was not performed. restore operation active A restore operation is currently active on this VP. verify operation active A verify operation is currently active on this VP. restore was canceled A restore operation was started but the canceled at the user's request. verify was canceled A verify operation was started but the canceled at the user's request. mirror needs repair A restore operation was attempted on a mirror that need to be repaired. memory allocation failure Buffer allocation necessary to perform a restore or verify operation were not available. cannot verify a 'forced' mirror A verify operation was attempted on a mirror that was created using the 'force' option. Since the mirror was never synchronized on a block-by-block basis, the verify operation is expected to fail. synchronization was lost during verify The verify operation was aborted due to a loss of synchronization. The error causing the loss of synchronization was not associated with the verify operation (an external event caused the loss). error reading primary device A restore or verify command aborted due to a read error on the primary device during the operation. error writing primary device A restore command aborted due to a write error on the primary device during the restore operation. error reading secondary device A restore or verify command aborted due to a read error on the secondary device during the operation. error writing secondary device A restore command aborted due to a write error on the secondary device during the restore operation. error accessing tertiary device A restore or verify command aborted due to failure either communicating with a Loop B client system or because of a read or write error on the tertiary device. verify error A verify error occured between the primary and secondary mirrored device. tertiary device verify error A verify error occured between the primary and tertiary mirrored device. status unavailable The restore status returned was invalid.

mhPartitionRestoreDate.name: mhPartitionRestoreDate
mhPartitionRestoreDate.description: Returns the date and time of the last partition restore, in DateAndTime format of 11 octets.

mhPartitionMountPoint.name: mhPartitionMountPoint
mhPartitionMountPoint.description: Returns a string denoting the mount-point name if this partition is the mount point for any file system. A null string is returned if this partition is not a mount point. MediaHawk Model 2000 Systems only.

mhPartitionFreeSpace.name: mhPartitionFreeSpace
mhPartitionFreeSpace.description: Applicable only if previous entry (mount point) returns a non-null string. Returns an integer from 0 to 99 indicating the percentage of free space in this partition. MediaHawk Model 2000 Systems only.

mhVPSubsystemHealth.name: mhVPSubsystemHealth
mhVPSubsystemHealth.description: Returns a string which indicates the overall health of the VP subsystem: none There are no mirrors confgiured. red At least one partition has reported a double or triple drive failure. yellow At least one partition has reported a single member fault. green All partitions are synchronized .
